name: Path T Palate Soft
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor on one side confined to:
       Lamina propria
       Submucosa
    Buccal mucosa (inner cheek)
    Gum (gingiva), upper
    Lateral pharyngeal wall
    Musculature invaded
    Tonsillar pillars and fossae
    Tonsils
    Tumor crosses midline

    Confined to soft palate
    Localized, NOS
footnotes: \* T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension

Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension OR 
extension to lingual surface of epiglottis

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Larynx
    Deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue, which are: 
        Genioglossus
        Hyoglossus
        Palatoglossus 
        Styloglossus
    Medial pterygoid
    Hard palate
    Mandible

Hypopharynx
Mandible
Maxilla  
Nasal cavity
Palatine bone (bone of hard palate)
Pterygoid muscle, medial or NOS
Tongue

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Lateral pterygoid muscle
    Pterygoid plates
    Lateral nasopharynx
    Skull base
    Encases carotid artery

Maxillary sinus (antrum) 
Nasopharynx, lateral or NOS
Pterygoid muscle, lateral
Pterygoid plates

Further contiguous extension including:
     Skull base

Stated as T4b
Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
